intro: Laserpitium latifolium subsp. latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, rocky habitats such as stream banks and forest floors. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
